intro: Prescottia spiranthophylla, commonly known as the spiral-leaf brodiaea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its unique spiral arrangement of leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and relatively rare species within its native range.
